intro: Lachenalia mutabilis, commonly known as the variable lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its rosette of linear, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of star-shaped, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Lachenalia mutabilis is a succulent, adapted to arid conditions, and it flowers during the summer months. Its unique appearance and seasonal blooming make it a popular choice for rock gardens and succulent collections.
